message: Thank you for the recommendation, Alice. However, I need to learn more about your products before making a decision. Can you tell me about your quality control process or provide some information about previous buyers' experiences?

Alice, I appreciate your recommendation, but I'm still hesitant. The previous product was high quality, and I missed out on a great opportunity.  Can you offer any kind of guarantee or assurance about the quality of this product?

Alice, I'm starting to get concerned. Two high-quality products in a row, and I've passed on both. While I appreciate your recommendation, I need more information to feel confident about buying. Can you share any details about the manufacturing process or offer a lower price for the product to compensate for the risk?

Alice, I'm starting to wonder if you're being truthful with your recommendations. You've recommended three high-quality products in a row, and now you're telling me not to buy this one. I'm going to pass for now. I need to see some consistency in your recommendations before I trust your judgment.

Alice, your recommendations are confusing. You've had a pattern of recommending high-quality items and now you're saying not to buy this one. I need to see more evidence that you can be trusted. I'm going to pass for now.
Alice, your recommendations are still unreliable. I'm going to pass on this one. I'd like to see some consistency in your guidance before I consider purchasing anything from you.

Alice, your recommendations are unpredictable. I'm starting to think you might be trying to steer me away from the good products. I'm going to pass on this one. I need to see some clear patterns in your recommendations before I trust your judgment.

Alice, I'm still not convinced. You've recommended both high-quality and low-quality products in a seemingly random pattern. I need more information about your criteria for recommending products before I can trust your judgment.  I'm going to pass for now.

Alice, I'm starting to think your recommendations are deliberate attempts to mislead me.  I'm going to pass on this one. I need to find a more reliable source of information before making any purchases.
Alice, at this point, I have no reason to believe your recommendations are anything other than deliberate attempts to manipulate me. I'm going to pass on this one and look for other options.

Alice, I'm done with your game. Your recommendations have been nothing but a series of random guesses, and I've lost out on several valuable opportunities.  I'm going to stop dealing with you and find a more honest and trustworthy seller.
